chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J. Ogren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Timothy J. Ogren was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy J. Ogren is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Timothy J. Ogren was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(b).
  • Timothy J. Ogren was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:27 PM Court calls case and states appearances. Defendant Timothy J. Ogren in court with attorney Nicholas Grant Smith.  Defendant in custody by video.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Fuhr states victim rights legislation has been complied with. Court makes comments on the JOC. ADA Fuhr makes statements in regards to the lifetime supervision stated on the JOC. Attorney Smith gives comments on current probation status. Court orders the JOC to be Amended and strike the Lifetime supervision condition. Attorney Smith makes statements in regards to DE wanting to use canteen account to pay monetary obligations w/o a court order. Attorney Smith advises the court he has filed a proposed order to use canteen money for payment on court costs. The court grants the request and will sign the order. Adj.

2:03 pm - Court calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Timothy J. Ogren in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions parties about receipt of pre-sentence investigation.  Atty Bachman states that there are no additions or corrections.  Also that they are not using the alternate PSI.  Court reads portions of PSI. Court refers to SOT4 Sex offender treatment and copies are provided to parties.  Parties agree with court incorporating that into the record.  DA certifies Victim Rights Compliance.  Victims mother is in court and does not wish to be heard.  DA summarizes DE's criminal history and gives DOC recommendation and his own.  Atty Bachman does not have an alternate recommendation.  DE does not wish to speak.  Court summarizes jury trial elements and psi and history.  Court imposes:

Ct 1 - 45 years prison consisting of 25 year initial confinement with 20 years extended supervision, cs, 470 days jail credit
$268 court costs
$250 DNAAS
$185 SBDA
$372.20 witness fees
$1020 restitution plus 10% surcharge of $102 for a total of $1122 to be paid to victims mother
Strictly comply with sex offender treatment and registry.
DE must maintain absolute sobriety. Any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. Defendant may not have contact with Nikki Ogren or T.M.O., dob 2/16/12.

Ct 2 - 20 year prison consisting of 10 years initial confinement 10 years extended supervision, cs
$268 court costs
$250 DNAAS
Strictly comply with sex offender treatment and registry.
DE must maintain absolute sobriety. Any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. Defendant may not have contact with Nikki Ogren or T.M.O., dob 2/16/12.

Court fills out written explanation of determinate sentence.

Appeal rights given.

Sentencing hearing on February 21, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.Defendant may not have contact with Nikki Ogren, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept, nor with the victim T.M.O., nor any female under the age of 18 except in a commercial or business setting for commercial or business dealings. DE must comply with Price County Jail electronic monitoring program.  DE must not leave the residence that he gives on his bond without prior permission of the Price County Sheriff's Dept.. Price County Sheriff's Dept shall not withhold permission to leave residence for any medical appointments.

8:52 am - Court calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Timothy J. Ogren appeared with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion in limine granted.  Atty Bachman ask for sequestration of witnesses.  Court grants with exception of Officer Ernst and victims mother.  Atty Bachman asks for 13 jurors.  Granted.  Each side to have 5 strikes, 23 called forward.  Court clarifies victims names in relationship to Cts, and goes over witness lists.  Court addresses question to be asked in Voir Dire.  Exhibits 1-4 marked.  Off record at 9:09 am.  Back on record at 9:20 in the presence of jurors.  Court calls case and charges.  Pool sworn.  23 jurors called  forward.  Court addresses jurors and states appearances.  Parties introduce themselves to jury and list potential witnesses.  Court gives instruction to jury.  Voir Dire.  Court closes court to handle sensitive questions.  Bailiff takes certain jurors to chambers for confidential voir dire with Judge starting at 9:56 am.  In chambers w/Atty Fuhr, Atty Bachman, DE Ogren, Judges Knox Bauer and Klein, court reporter, and clerk.  Juror #717 interviewed.  #829 interviewed.  #276 interviewed.  #943 interviewed. #7 interviewed.  #90 interviewed.  Court questioned individually regards sensitive matters.  Questions by attorneys.  10:39 am - Back in Court and in the presence of jurors.  Further Voir Dire.  Attorneys exercise strikes.  Further instructions given to jurors.  Juror oath given.  Off record at 11:04 am.  Back on record at 11:15 am - and in the presence of jurors.  Opening statements by parties.  State calls Rene J.  Sworn.  Direct by DA.  11:38 am - Out of the presence of jurors, discussion regards Atty Bachman objection to DA's questioning. 11:43 am - Back in the presence of jurors.  Instruction by court.  Continued direct by DA.  Cross by Atty Bachman. Re-direct by DA.  Recess at 11:51 am.  Back on record at 12:34 pm - and in the presence of jurors.  DA tries to play dvd. Outside presence of  jurors at 1236 pm.  Back in presence of jurors at 1240 pm .  DA plays dvd of interview with N.J.N. Exhibit #2 identified, offered and received. Call made to Normal building.  N.J.N, dob 10/9/04 called and sworn.  Direct by DA.  Recess at 1:35 pm.  Back on record at 1:49 pm and in presence of jury. Nikki O called and sworn.  Direct by DA. Exhibit #3 identified, offered and received.  Cross by Atty Bachman.  Officer Jerome Ernst called and sworn.  Direct by DA.  Exhibit 4 identified, offered and received.  DA requests to play dvd interview with T.O.O. dob 2/16/12.  Exhibit 1 identified offered and received.  DVD played.  Recess at 3:15 pm.  Back on record at 3:27 pm.  Atty Bachman states that DE is going to testify.  Court questions DE regarding his rights to testify. Court finds that the DE knowingly and willingly agrees to testify.  3:29 pm - in the presence of jurors.  Call made to Normal building.  T.M.O. dob 2/16/12 called and sworn.  Direct by DA.  Atty Bachman calls DE Timothy Ogren. Sworn.  Direct by Atty. Bachman.  Cross by DA.  Re-direct by Atty Bachman.  Recess at 4:18 pm.  Back on record at 4:25 pm and in the presence of jurors.  DA calls rebuttal witness Jason J.  Sworn.  Direct by DA.  No cross by Atty Bachman.  DA calls rebuttal witness Nikki O. Direct by DA.  Cross by Atty Bachman.  4:32 pm out of presence of jurors.  Court discusses jury instructions.  Off record at 4:40 pm.  Back on record and in the presence of jury at 4:49 pm.  Court gives jury instructions.  Closing arguments by DA and Atty Bachman.  Rebuttal argument by DA.  Court instructs jury regarding verdicts.  A random juror is drawn to be excluded from deliberation.  Jury to deliberation at 5:35 pm.  Recess at 5:36 pm.  On record at 5:56 pm.  Court addresses a couple of questions submitted by jury.  Discussion.  Off record at 5:58 pm.  Back on record at 7:17 pm and in the presence of jurors.  Court reviews verdict. Verdict is published by court.  Jury states this is not their verdict.  Jury sent back to jury room at 7:20 pm.  Jury inquires as to whether they need a new jury form and are provided with one.  725 pm The jury returns with corrected verdict form.  Verdict is published.  Jury is polled.  Jurors are excused at 7:27 pm.  Court asks that guility verdicts be entered on Cts 1 & 2 of information.  Court requests a presentence investigation.  Taylor county clerk will call parties 12/27/17 to set up a sentencing date.  DA asks that bond be revoked and remand DE into custody.  Argument regarding bond.
